challenges.title: CAD Basics: Your First Shape
challenges.description: Learn the fundamentals by creating and modifying basic shapes
objectives: Add a cube to the scene
Resize the cube to 2x2x2 units
Rotate the cube 45 degrees around the Y-axis (vertical)
Change the material to blue
hints: Look for the cube button in the shapes panel
Use the scale tool or properties panel to resize to 2x2x2
Use the rotation tool and rotate around the Y-axis (vertical green arrow) by 45 degrees
Materials can be changed in the properties panel - look for blue color

challenges.title: Ergonomic Spoon for Arthritis
challenges.description: Design an easy-grip spoon handle for users with arthritis
objectives: Create a spoon bowl using a scaled sphere
Design a thick, ergonomic handle using a cylinder
Connect the bowl and handle smoothly
Ensure the handle diameter is at least 2cm for easy grip
hints: Arthritis users need thicker handles for easier gripping
Use boolean union to connect parts seamlessly
Consider the weight distribution
Test different handle angles for comfort
challenges.realWorldContext: People with arthritis often struggle with thin utensil handles. Thicker handles reduce strain on joints.

challenges.title: One-Handed Phone Stand
challenges.description: Create a stable phone stand that can be operated with one hand
objectives: Design a stable base using geometric shapes
Create an angled phone rest at 60-70 degrees
Add a lip to prevent phone from sliding
Ensure the stand works for phones 4-7 inches tall
hints: Wide base prevents tipping
Angle should be comfortable for viewing
Consider how someone would place/remove phone with one hand
Test with different phone sizes
challenges.realWorldContext: Users with limited mobility in one arm need stands they can operate independently.

challenges.title: Adaptive Soap Holder
challenges.description: Design a soap holder with finger slots for users with weak grip
objectives: Create a base tray for soap drainage
Add finger slots for easy gripping
Include drainage holes
Design for standard soap bar dimensions
hints: Finger slots should be deep enough for secure grip
Drainage prevents soap from becoming slippery
Consider different hand sizes
Smooth edges prevent injury
challenges.realWorldContext: Users with conditions like Parkinson's or arthritis need secure grip options for daily hygiene.

challenges.title: Wheelchair Cup Holder
challenges.description: Design a cup holder that attaches to wheelchair armrests
objectives: Create a secure cup holder ring
Design an adjustable clamp mechanism
Add safety features to prevent spills
Ensure compatibility with standard wheelchairs
hints: Consider different cup sizes and shapes
Clamp should fit various armrest thicknesses
Anti-tip features are crucial
Easy one-handed operation is important
challenges.realWorldContext: Wheelchair users need accessible drink holders that don't interfere with mobility.

challenges.title: Braille Learning Blocks
challenges.description: Create tactile learning blocks with raised Braille patterns
objectives: Design cube blocks with raised dots
Create accurate Braille letter patterns
Ensure proper dot spacing and height
Make blocks stackable and durable
hints: Braille dots must be precise for recognition
Standard Braille cell is 6 dots in 2x3 pattern
Dot height should be tactilely distinct
Consider manufacturing constraints
challenges.realWorldContext: Tactile learning tools help visually impaired individuals learn Braille effectively.
